data.title: User Dialog for Visual Studio Version

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
- As shown in [this thread](http://www.fetzenet.de/forum/viewtopic.php?f=4&t=113), there appears to be a problem with the default project template for plugins.
- Especially for beginners, this is a probable roadblock. It should be fixed ASAP.

data.title: Improve Project View

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: New systems and modules requiring a significant amount of long-term effort.

data.body:
- The Project View does its job very well. _However_, when working in large projects, it gets pretty crowded in there and even using clever folder structures doesn't prevent at least some overview to be lost.
- The interface should be reworked in order to provide a better overview. All of these changes should be optional and user-configurable!
  - The [UDK Content Browser](http://i1.ytimg.com/vi/EOae7z9jRKU/maxresdefault.jpg) does a great job.
  - Split folder and file view.
  - Provide previews for each Resource.
- A full-fledged content browser requires a lot more space than the currently implemented folder / file view.
  - In some cases, the small version might be preferable.
  - It may be a good idea to derive the Project Views display mode from it's dimensions in the editor UI. 
    - Need a better overview? Scale it up!
    - Need more space for other UI modules? Scale it down!
- For later implementations of Resource selectors etc. it may be a good idea to split the "Project View" implementation from a possibly existing `ProjectResourceView` `Control`.
  - The Project View would simply contain a ProjectResourceView, its current buttons and the search bar and also take care of selection and dragdrop events, etc.
  - The ProjectResourceView would take care of all the displaying and auto-update because of file system events and the like. It should also provide a suitable interface to implement custom dragdrop operations.

data.title: Better Editor Memory Management
data.body:
As BraveSirAndrew stated in a different issue:

> The engine is currently compiled in x86 mode, which as you know gives us access   to only 4GB of memory, and .NET limits that to under 2GB. While developing, we're not compressing our textures, and as a result have sometimes as much as 2GB or more of data loaded. The solution is to modify the DualityLauncher exe with the LARGEADDRESSAWARE flag so it can access an extra gig or two of memory. See http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1272096/resharper-throws-outofmemoryexception-on-big-solution for an example of how to set the flag. This seems to work fine, but I'm making a fairly big assumption that Duality doesn't do anything funny with pointer arithmetic.

It seems, Dualitor runs out of memory for very large projects. While it would be in theory possible to make Duality a full AnyCPU / x64 application with some more work on the dependencies, this is certainly not a solution.

Instead, Dualitor should manage its memory more efficiently - unlike the game, it's likely that all Resources are loaded during its runtime at once, which will exceed any memory limit easily, if a project grows in size. There should be some mechanism to unload large Resources when the memory runs low.
- Flag Resources with the potential to become very large with a special attribute
- The `ContentProvider` should get some kind of Cleanup method where large Resources are unloaded.
- There should be some mechanism to determine when a Resource was used last or how often it was used in the last few minutes, which could be the basis for deciding _which_ Resources to unload.
- Unloading Resources that are still used won't be a problem - they'll be reloaded when needed anyway.
- It is probably a good idea to just unload the oldest large Resource, as it will serve as some kind of usage metric. When used, it will be loaded again directly, making it the newest Resource and unattractive to the cleanup algorithm. When unused, it won't be loaded again.
- The Cleanup method shouldn't do anything when there is enough memory available to fit in more large Resources.
- The Cleanup method should never touch Resources the ContentProvider class can't reload itself i.e. runtime, default or manually registered / aliased Resources.
- Always get rid of very large Resources first. Leave the small ones alone, as long as there are a lot of larger ones.
- What mechanisms of memory management are provided by .Net? What's with WeakReference and the like? Can they be used efficiently for memory management in the editor?
  - [WeakReference](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.weakreference.aspx)
  - [GC.KeepAlive](http://defragdev.com/blog/?p=129)
  - [WeakReference and IDisposable](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2841225/weak-references-and-disposable-objects)
  - [GC.GetTotalmemory](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.gc.gettotalmemory.aspx)

data.title: Remove MetaFormat Serialization
data.body:
The Serialization MetaFormat serves the following purposes:
- Provide insight to raw but structured serialized data.
- Allow to modify such data and serialize it afterwards.
- Convert different serialization formats even when data is damaged i.e. cannot be deserialized correctly.
- Maintenance tasks, such as renaming Types, Namespaces, etc.

However, due to ongoing Duality development, all of those tasks are no longer valid and / or can be done otherwise using existing systems.
- Insight to serialized data was far more important when there was no XML serialization. Now there is.
- Data can be modified by deserializing the actual objects and serializing them again. This has proven to be very reliable in almost all cases.
- Damaged data can now be handled by providing suitable ErrorHandler classes to the Type resolver.
- Maintenance tasks such as renaming could be achieved by extending the Formatter base class to modify Type resolve behavior.

As shown, the MetaFormat is no longer a necessity. Removing it will lead to a cleaner codebase and make introducing new serialization formats more easy.
- BinaryFormatterBase and XmlFormatterBase could be merged with BinaryFormatter and XmlFormatter. They were only there in the first place to serve the respective MetaFormatter classes.
- The whole MetaFormat namespace can be removed, along with a lot of hard-to-use classes and code that is specifically tailored to use them.
- The ResourceHacker will become obsolete and can be removed completely.

data.title: Fix Demo Downloads
data.body:
- "Blob is too large" error
- Find a way to distribute large binaries via GitHub
- Use the "Releases" Feature?
  - Create a new, empty branch called "downloads"
  - Store all the techdemos inside that branch and remove them from the main branch
  - Create a new release for each techdemo and attach its binary file?
  - They can't be updated later :(
- Use an external provider?
  - Dropbox, like for the bachelor thesis
  - [BinTray](www.bintray.com)
  - Other?

data.title: TextRendering based on Distance Fields
data.body:
- The distance field technique described [here](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CGZRHJvJYIg) allows very sharp text rendering at any scale.
- Dualiy would benefit from such implementation. It doesn't look very hard as well and could be implemented with relatively low effort.
- However, the old, pure mode should still be available for later "custom bitmap font" support.
- Introduce a new Font.RenderMode enum that replaces "GlyphRenderHint" and "Filtering" properties
  - MonochromeBitmap
  - SmoothBitmap
  - Vector
- Rendering distance-field based Fonts will require a custom DrawTechnique.
  - Add it to the pool of default DrawTechniques?
  - Use a local / private DrawTechnique?
- Note that TextRenderers using a CustomMaterial will need to use a temporary DrawTechnique so the proper shader is applied for Vector mode Fonts.

data.title: Better multi-monitor support
data.body:
If Duality is closed while any views are detached and floating, either on the same monitor or on a separate monitor, the editor is completely frozen on re-opening. 

To workaround, editoruserdata.xml must be deleted, which resets the editor layout back to default.

data.title: Editor + Launcher doesnt start in system without audio.
data.body:
New Microsoft update for Hight Definition Audio (every Intel on-board audio) broke Duality (OpenTK) audio.

Now, without physically connected repro / headphones, you dont have any audio device (Which was really bad idea, btw...). Audio device "magically" appear after connecting headphones.
##### Problem:

Exception:

> Failed to create dummy Context. Device (0) Context (0) MakeContextCurrent succeeded, Alc Error (InvalidDevice) Invalid Device

Inner exception:

> null

Duality.SoundDevice.ctor (:146 in rev dd8166663c311b1eb715ba3adba672d78f77856 )

Part of call stack:

> Duality.dll!Duality.SoundDevice.SoundDevice()
> Duality.dll!Duality.DualityApp.Init(Duality.DualityApp.ExecutionEnvironment env, > Duality.DualityApp.ExecutionContext context, string[] args) Line 367
> DualityEditor.exe!DualityEditor.DualityEditorApp.Init(DualityEditor.Forms.MainForm mainForm, bool recover) Line 198
> DualityEditor.exe!DualityEditor.Forms.SplashScreen.InitEditor() Line 24
> [Native to Managed Transition]    
##### Solution:

You have to physically connect repro or headphones.
##### Expected Solution:

Duality should be prepared for machine without any audio card / device and run just fine without any sounds...
##### More info:

DxDiag without connected repro (in czech, i dont know how to change language :) )
https://docs.google.com/file/d/0BzMq5E4zc9XgN3pxRG55NTVlQ3M/edit?usp=sharing

DxDiag with connected repro:
https://docs.google.com/file/d/0BzMq5E4zc9Xgd3hONURXZnIybW8/edit?usp=sharing

Diff:
without physically connected repro, there simly isnt any Sound Device...

data.title: New scenes are initialized before old scenes are shutdown
data.body: When switching scenes in the editor with sandbox mode active, the game objects of the new scene are initialized before the game objects from the current scene are shut down.

data.title: Test Issue
data.body: This issue has purely been created to see what happens when closing an issue.

data.title: Refactor FileImport system

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: New systems and modules requiring a significant amount of long-term effort.

data.body:
Problem:
- The current FileImport system is VERY limited.
  - It doesn't support importing multiple files as single Resource
  - It doesn't support creating multiple Resources from a single file
  - It doesn't know how to extract Resources without some hacky editor action telling.
  - It doesn't manage the Media/Source folder very well (although temporary)
  - It operates on a single-file basis
  - It can't be configured in any way by the user and wouldn't be able to keep his settings in mind for re-importing a Resource later
    - Images: Color Masking to Alpha
    - AudioData: Normalize
    - ...
  - It's potentially slow in ReImport for very large numbers of Resources, because it potentially needs to touch every existing Resource in order to find out where a source file belongs to.
- Management of import / config meta-data as well as source-target associations should NOT happen as part of a Resource.
- Temporary(?), User-Local(?) .meta files in the Source/Media/ folder?

data.title: Decentralize Scenes
data.body:
Problem:
- Right now, there is global access to the current Scene and it is used everywhere.
- There is always one Scene "current" and there is no way to simulate or render more than one Scene at once.

Solution A:
- Allow any number of Scenes to be "current" and get rid of that ugly global access pattern.
  - A GameObject should know to which Scene it belongs and should only be able to belong to one Scene at once.
  - Each Scene carries its own PhysicsWorld.
- The editor is built around a single-Scene concept and it should stay like this.
  - Maybe keep one primary active Scene and multiple optional secondary active Scenes.
  - The editor mostly uses the primary one and only acts on secondaries when reloading plugins and such.

General Note:
- This is a very deep change and it's only useful in corner cases.
- Main benefit of this issue would be a clearer and cleaner software structure.
- It might also be useful if a GameObject knows where it belong in some cases.
- Before beginning, reconsider the issue and its implications. Approach carefully.

data.title: Improve Physics API

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
Problem:
- The current Duality Physics API does not include a lot of useful Farseer Physics features.
  - Texture to polygon
  - Cutting Shapes
  - A lot of polygon utility methods
    - Make any polygon clockwise
    - Check whether a polygon is convex
    - Decomposing non-convex polygons to multiple convex ones (Convex Decomposition)
  - Controller Support
    - Wind, Gravity, Buoyancy, VelocityLimit
    - Custom Controllers
      - Provide a flexible base class (Component) that works on RigidBodies / Duality, but is a Farseer Controller internally?
      - Does it even need to be a Farseer Controller?
      - Is there even a need for such base class? The user can always just iterate over RigidBodies in the Scene.
- Dualitor could probably also benefit from some of these features
  - When adding a RigidBody to a GameObject with a SpriteRenderer etc. automatically generate a starting shape from the used primary texture.
  - This could be done using the Convert API to keep it extensible. Just ask for a collection of ShapeInfos and add converters for SpriteRenderer-to-ShapeInfo, etc.
- Dualitor, RigidBody Editor:
  - Add a "Freeform Polygon" tool that allows any kind of polygon using any number of vertices that automatically decomposes the user input after finishing the operation.
  - Add a "Move Vertices" tool that allows moving already set vertices.
  - To allow all that, move the default cursor state to a distinct toolbar button. 
  - Probably refactor some RigidBodyEditor code so all this can be implemented in a clean way without hacking.
  - Make sure switching modes behaves intuitively.
  - Add keyboard shortcuts for new modes.

Solution:
- Implement this.

data.title: Auto-Update for Dualitor
data.body:
Problem:
- Updating Duality to a new version is a frequent and repeating task:
  - Download the current build
  - Unpack it
  - Copy files to the local Duality folder.
  - Recompile the game plugins.
- Some updates might be missed or introduced late.
- Users might use a wide variety of different Duality versions, which makes support more difficult.

Solution:
- Introduce an entirely optional (!!!) auto-updating mechanism.
- When active, check once on startup whether there are new versions available.
- Also show some kind of "What's new" before and / or after the update.
  - Data can be automatically compiled by NightlyBuilder
  - Introduce some kind of commit message standard based on hashtags.
      #ADD / #FIX / #CHANGE / #REMOVE / #USER / #PRIO
  - Should distill the actual message and ignore pseudo text formatting like "-->", "-", etc.
  - URLs should also be evaluated and used as "Whats New" entry link.
- When desired, automatically perform the necessary steps to update the project.

data.title: UndoRedo for IList elements doesn't work
data.body:
- When modifying an IList element (or probably an IDictionary element), there is no proper UndoRedoAction hook - instead, an empty action gets logged that doesn't do anything.
- Need to introduce an equivalent to MemberwisePropertyEditor.MemberValueSetter for IList and IDictionary editors in the CustomPropertyGrid project
- Secondly, empty actions should somehow be prevented to get logged.
  - This is a tricky case since there is no apparent "this action is void". They simply refer to dead or no longer used objects.

data.title: Optimize Prefab-linked GameObject serialization
data.body:
- Currently, GameObjects that are linked to Prefabs are fully serialized in a Scene. This is highly redundant.
- It also adds unnecessary differences in Scenes when changing Prefabs because they are applied to their instances inside the Scene. This might be a problem for usability when working with version control systems.
- However, simply not saving a GameObjects Components isn't an option as they might be referenced by other objects.
- Instead, not saving most of their fields might be an option. They won't diff, they won't bloat the Scene, the objects are in place, everything's fine.
  - Check if really everything IS fine, though. What about references to objects stored in fields that would be omitted during serialization?
  - Well, they would be replaced by OnCopyTo anyway when the Prefab is applied - except if they're in the change list.
  - Think about other cases that could break this approach.

data.title: Undo should mind PrefabLink changelists

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
- Currently, an Undo operation won't undo automatically set PrefabLink changelist entries.
- Would be handy, if it could also undo them.
- Could probably be solved by modifying DualityEditorApp.OnObjectPropertyChanged to pop changes when their target value equals the Prefabs source value.
  - Test performance. Don't do it, if it's too slow. This is just a nice2have special case.
- Another option would be to push changes to changelists via UndoRedoAction.
  - It would require that all possibly Prefab-affecting operations are properly set up as multi-actions so those changelist actions don't show up individually.
  - Might otherwise still be a better solution than always popping changes when the new value equals their original one - this is error-prone and costly.

data.title: Copy / Paste for GameObjects and Components

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
- Instead of the current Clone functionality, implement a proper Cut / Copy / Paste
- Use the Clipboard
- Apply to SceneView and CamView
- Use Case: Copy GameObject and Paste it somewhere else (Hierarchially)
- Use Case: Copy Component and Paste it into a different GameObject
- ...

data.title: Allow PropertyGrid DragDrop

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
- Introduce DragDrop operations on the PropertyGrid
- When dragging the label of a PropertyEditor, default behavior is to begin a drag operation using the current value, just like when pressing Ctrl+C
- Accordingly, dropping of suitable values should also be supported. There should be some kind of highlight effect if the operation is supported.
- BatchInfo, ContentRef, GameObjectRef and ComponentRef editors should react on the base implementation of dragdrop instead of rolling up their own drop support
- In addition to DragDrop on PropertyEditor labels, it should also be possible to do on GroupedPropertyEditor headers, but implemented in MemberwisePropertyEditors. The default implementation could perform a memberwise assignment based on the displayed values
- However, the ComponentPropertyEditor and GameObjectPropertyEditor should provide a custom CopyTo-based implementation

data.title: EditorHintCategory
data.body:
- In addition to the existing EditorHint attributes, introduce a new one that sets a certain CorePluginRegistry category if not done explicitly
- While at it, move the namespace default to CorePluginRegistry.GetTypeCategory as well

data.title: Dualitor Settings dialog

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: New systems and modules requiring a significant amount of long-term effort.

data.body:
- A dialog that displays all Dualitor settings in different tabs / pages
- Backups
- AutoSaves
- Which programs to use for opening different Source/Media files from the editor. User-definable list, if something is not set just use explorer default like now.
- Resource file format (Bin / Xml)

data.title: Improved HelpAdvisor display

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
- The HelpAdvisor should feature rich text and simple text flow controls.
- It should be "justify"-ed, because that looks better
- Allow simple text formatting like bold, italic or underlined.
- See if there are any renderers that can already do that
- Looks promising: http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/32376/A-Professional-HTML-Renderer-You-Will-Use

data.title: Remove unmanaged OggVorbis
data.body:
- The OggVorbis implementation is based on an external P/Invoke library. Which is neither necessary nor cool. Consider getting rid of it.
- A full C# implementation is possible and might even be without significant performance loss. However, this should be verified first.
- Take a look at the DragonOgg library, it pretty much does the same as the currently used OggVorbis library (?)

data.title: Allow to fully configure the CamView Camera
data.body:
- Will be necessary to work efficiently with custom Renderpass setups in order to provide a suitable preview
- Also nice: Keep the currently selected CamView Camera even when entering / leaving sandbox mode
- Button for selecting the internal Camera
- Button for copying the CamViews selected Camera state to the internal one
- The Camera Component needs to be saved completely to the editoruserdata.xml file

data.title: Renamed prefabs retain previous name

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Create a prefab
2. Rename it in Project View
3. Drag the prefab into a scene and notice that the name of the new game object is the prefabs previous name.

Would expect the game object to be named after the prefabs current name.

data.title: Should DrawDevice.AddVertices always copy data?
data.body:
Problem:
- AddVertices usually doesn't copy incoming data, which is a pitfall and hard to diagnose when done wrong.
- Always copying might be a problem for performance, but due to batching, most data gets copied anyway sooner or later.
- Plus, when always copying, this is an opportunity to allocate enough internal buffering space right from the beginning.

Solution:
- Investigate.

data.title: Cross-Platform Support

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: New systems and modules requiring a significant amount of long-term effort.

data.body:
- Since Duality is using OpenTK, it should in theory be possible to run it with Mono / on different platforms than Windows
- Some dependencies might be problematic indeed and need to be removed or replaced. OggVorbis might be an example
- While making the engine itself multiplatform-ready seems like an achievable goal, the editor will probably need a lot more work.
- Will need a testing environment / system and someone with Mono experience

data.title: Easy to forget deactivating Sandbox mode
data.body:
Problem:
- It is very easy for a Dualitor user to forget that he's entered Sandbox mode.
- When editing anyway, all of his changes will be lost due to the Scene setback after leaving the Sandbox.
- This may lead to unwanted data loss.

Solution A:
- Make it really obvious that Sandbox mode is active. Something the user can't miss.
- Probably deactivate some GUI modules during Sandbox mode, if they're not intended to be used in this state.

data.title: Add a Cam View visibility menu

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
- Remove the "Only show RigidBody objects" from the RigidBody editor.
- Instead, introduce a new Object Visibility menu similar to the Cam View Layer menu where each kind of objects can be activated or deactivated.
- Save the settings for each Cam View State the same as with active view layers.
- Dynamically erive object categories from the ones available in the current Scene, based on Component Types that are existing in GameObjects with an attached ICmpRenderer.
  - If a Type is present in all objects, don't add it to the list.
  - If a Type is present in no object at all, don't add it to the list.
- GameObjects that contain at least one active Type will be shown.

data.title: Dualitor: Deploy dialog
data.body:
- A new dialog that can "build" the game for deployment in a target folder
- Minimal folder contents, do NOT include anything that isn't needed!
- Save all Resources
- Build Plugin Solution
- Option: Move to subfolder and provide a single launcher .exe to hide all those peksy bin files to the end user
- Option: Include Source Code?
- Option: Include Editor?
- Option: Pack to .zip file?
